snippet: “The Jinx,” a six-part HBO documentary series about Robert A. Durst, raises questions about whether the filmmakers had a responsibility to share their discoveries with the police.
abstract: Andrew Jarecki and Marc Smerling documentary series The Jinx got a lucky dose of publicity before its finale when film's subject Robert A Durst was arrested on murder charge, but timing also raises ethical concerns; Durst apparently confessed to several murders in series, which underscores questions about the responsibilities filmmakers and journalists have when they uncover evidence in ongoing investigations.
lead_paragraph: “The Jinx,” a six-part HBO documentary series about Robert A. Durst, raises questions about whether the filmmakers had a responsibility to share their discoveries with the police.
